subtitle: Clean hands help stop you getting sick
title: Why wash my hands?
content:
Created by BabyCenter



You do not want to get sick while you are pregnant.

Wash your hands regularly with soap. Encourage your family to do it as well. Keeping your hands clean helps to prevent illnesses like pneumonia and diarrhea.

**Wash your hands:**

•	when you come home

•	after you go to the bathroom

•	after dealing with animals

•	before cooking 

•	after handling raw eggs, meat or fish

•	before you eat

•	after using public transportation

**Here is how to do it:**

•	You need water and soap

•	Put a good amount of soap on to your palm

•	Rub both hands together, palm to palm, to make a lather

•	If you are using a bar of soap, turn it round in your hands until you work up a good lather

•	Clean between your fingers

•	Make sure you wash your wrists, hands and nails

•	Continue rubbing your hands, on both sides, for at least 15 seconds

•	Wash the soap off your hands with water

•	Dry your hands using a clean towel 


Just by washing your hands, you can really reduce the risk of diseases like diarrhea.
